name: tepidly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not enthusiastic: The actor tepidly supported the candidate, and only did so when she was publicly asked whom she was voting for. The financial markets reacted tepidly to Monday's announcement.
More examplesFewer examplesThe presidential candidates all greeted the agreement rather tepidly. The film was tepidly received by critics and audiences, yet it still managed to be nominated for several awards. Wall Street responded rather tepidly to reports of the planned merger.
